description.narrative: DISCONTINUED FROM JAN 2015: CFS sector-wide SESP/SESPs/LESOPs that mitigate/respond to emergency implemented in 13 States and 2 LGAs in each of these states by end of 2017, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: DISCONTINUED FROM JAN 2015: By 2017, at least 90% of target states and LGAs have strengthened education systems, strategies and human resources that enable sustainable and equitable access to quality basic education by 2017

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: DISCONTINUED FROM JAN 2015: CFS sector-wide SESP/SESPs/LESOPs that mitigate/respond to emergency implemented in 13 States and 2 LGAs in each of these states by end of 2017
# of SESP/SESOP Core Team members trained

actual.value: 2014:185 officials drawn from 13 states the 5 GEP, 8 non-GEP and 3 DaO states have been given different trainings in SESP-SESOP development processes and computer aided budgeting and planning tools, Human Rights based Programming, Results Based Management and application of EPSSim modelling tool in secto

title.narrative: # of States with EPR Contingency Plans

actual.value: 2014:45 selected schools identified for training in four states of Borno, Yobe, Gombe and Taraba

title.narrative: # of states that have and are implementing their SESP-SESOP

actual.value: 2014:Six including three DaO states have reviewed/developed and are implementing their Education Sector Plans.
